attributes.action: Guarantee rights of all EU citizens in UK as condition of Art 50 notice
attributes.background:
If the UK claims to open to the world, it needs to lead by example. 

It is the right thing to do morally and will create goodwill with the EU/other Member States. As a by product, it means they will come under pressure to reciprocate for UK citizens in the EU.

attributes.action: make babys able to be registered from 16 weeks & death certificates to be given
attributes.background:
I'm starting this petition to try make it so all babies can be registered from 16 weeks and death certificates can be given even if the baby never took a breath. 
Please help me to make this happen, it would mean so much to so many people who have been in the same situation as myself. Thank you.
attributes.additional_details: I lost one of my twin girls to TTTS at 19 weeks and although I will never forget my girl, she will never be truly recognised as a baby by law because she died before 24 weeks. It hurts me daily knowing I will never have that certificate to prove her existence to her twin sister, I would do anything to be able to see my little girl recognised. Just 1 little piece of paper might seem like nothing but for someone who has lost their beautiful baby it could mean the world. 1 signature costs nothing.

attributes.action: Source funding to complete the International Bomber Command Centre
attributes.background: The government is committed to donate £20M to a memorial to the Normandy Campaign from the Libor fund, which is considered a fitting tribute. We request a similar donation, estimated at £3m, be debated in Parliament to be made, to enable the new International Bomber Command Centre to be completed.
attributes.additional_details:
The International Bomber Command Centre (IBCC) is being created to provide a world-class facility to serve as a point for recognition, remembrance and reconciliation for Bomber Command. 
The project includes recording, preserving and relating the stories of all those involved with or impacted by Bomber Command during the Second World War.  Covering the contribution of the men and women from over 60 nations, at all levels, the project will bring to life not only the period of the War, but the fight to gain recognition and the work undertaken to rebuild Europe's cities

attributes.action: Renew the UK work visa for the professional wrestlers Dahlia Black and TK Cooper
attributes.background: Dahlia Black & TK Cooper are professional wrestlers from New Zealand who have come to the UK and established themselves as two of the most talented performers on the UK Independent wrestling scene.They are being sent home to NZ as their visas have expired. Show support for their visas being renewed!

attributes.action: Make PIP standard for cystic Fibrosis
attributes.background:
Cystic fibrosis is an inherited condition in which the lungs and digestive system can become clogged with thick, sticky mucus.
It can cause problems with breathing and digestion from a young age. Over many years, the lungs become increasingly damaged and may eventually stop working properly.
attributes.additional_details:
Most cases of cystic fibrosis in the UK are now identified through screening tests carried out soon after birth. It's estimated that 1 in every 2,500 babies born in the UK has cystic fibrosis.
A number of treatments are available to help reduce the problems caused by the condition, but unfortunately average life expectancy is reduced for people who have it. Extra stress also doesn't help.

attributes.action: Have the A1 & A2 Motorcycle Licence automatically upgrade after 2 years
attributes.background:
Upgrade the A1 to a A2 after 2 years.
Upgrade the A2 to a full licence after 2 years.
Why? 
car drivers can drive a vehicle with any power after one test, why can't us bikers?
At least with 2 years experience of each licence, surely that is enough experience to be given the privilege to move up?
attributes.additional_details: Bikers must complete a CBT test for a 125. Then another test for the A1 licence that is for a 125 AGAIN. what consists of a theory test, a module 1 and a module 2, and then they have to wait to be older anyway to go for the A2 licence what again consists of a module 1 & a module 2 , then for the full A licence they must do ANOTHER! module 1 and module 2 test, and to prepare for the tests, training is needed consisting at least 5 lessons costing a bomb! and takes up alot your time. It's over kill

attributes.action: Same sex couples to receive funded fertility treatment without self funding six
attributes.background: Me and my partner (female same sex couple) desperately want to start a family together but were refused funding for fertility treatment unless we self fund six times and was unsucessful however, a heterosexual couple can receive funded fertility treatment without paying other fertility clinics.
attributes.additional_details: After visiting many fertility clinics we found that starting a family is very costly, with the cheapest option being Intrauterine insemination (IUI) with only a 15% success rate. On average this costing between £2,000-£3,500 for one single cycle. This times by six is an unreasonable amount to pay before even being considered for funded treatment. Many same sex couples like myself are missing a great opportunity to start a family.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for Landlord to discriminate against people on Housing Benefits
attributes.background: Most private landlords, letting agancies and even mortgage companies stipulate in their terms and conditions, that the house can not be rented to anyone on benefits.  With very low stock of social housing this has created a housing crisis for poorer people and families.
attributes.additional_details: This is discrimination against a group of people,  based on an assumption of negative traits and should be declared illegal.

attributes.action: Affordable Clear Citizenship Path for all who earned Permanent Leave to Remain.
attributes.background: This is vital in the context of Brexit as it would remove the threat of unjust deportation from many long term resident from the EU and is recommended in report by the All-Party Parliamentary Group (APPG) on Social Integration Integration http://www.socialintegrationappg.org.uk/reports
attributes.additional_details:
The report by the All-Party Parliamentary Group (APPG) on Social Integration recommends "reducing the naturalisation
fees, which have recently spiralled to just under £1,200—almost ten times the cost to the Home Office of processing the application, and over six times more than the cost in countries such as Germany and Canada" and providing a clear guided path to citizenship for all long term residents from other countries including those from other EU countries.

attributes.action: England should be given a referendum on leaving the United Kingdom.
attributes.background: England should be afforded the same democratic rights as Scotland by being offered a referendum on leaving the union.

attributes.action: Stop The Human Rights Abuse: Suspend Diplomatic Relations with Cameroon
attributes.background:
Within the past few weeks, Cameroon police have been beating up protesters including Common Law Lawyers. Some civilians have died and many injured. 
Social media is awash with images of lawyers assaulted by security forces, their wigs and gowns confiscated

Stop this from becoming a genocide!
attributes.additional_details:
The protests,  began with Lawyers, teachers and spread to student bodies, are all against the systematic marginalisation of English-speaking Cameroonians. 
See http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-africa-38078238 

See http://bareta.press/federalism-political-issue-pm-tells-lawyers/ 

THEIR DEMAND IS FOR A TWO-STATE FEDERATION WITH EQUAL AUTONOMY 

Please ask the UK to suspend diplomatic relations with Cameroon until it stops its crackdown on peaceful protesters and start listening to their demands

attributes.action: Amnesty from prosecution and questioning of British Forces Veterans
attributes.background: The questioning and subsequent charging of ex service personnel, needs to stop. These serviceman and women served their country in good faith under orders and within the 'rules of engagement'. We, ex and current service personnel won't stand by and watch good men and women hanged out to dry.

attributes.action: Repeal The Hunting Act
attributes.background: The hunting act is a poorly constructed and worded piece of legislation, time for repeal
attributes.additional_details: The hunting act is a poorly constructed and worded piece of legislation. Having been in place for over ten years now it has not saved a single fox; hare or deer, only subjected them to less humane methods of control. It is now time to revisit this subject and repeal this ill thought out piece of legislation

attributes.action: Accept more visas from Pakistan
attributes.background: People applying for Visa from Pakistan are being unfairly treated.  Figures obtained from UK Immigration & Visa office state that visa acceptance from Pakistan in 2015 was 46.9% & from India it was 89.2%.In 2016 up to September 30th the figure was 46.1% from Pakistan & 87% from India, highly unjust.

attributes.action: Restoration of Right of Appeal on Immigration Applications of Elderly Parents
attributes.background: That right of Appeal has been taken away from all immigrants including children, elderly people and the infirm. We demand that appeal rights be restored in order for the fair, open and democratic Legal system in this country. Elderly parents are the most adversely affected category.
attributes.additional_details: Before current Immigration Rules and Policy Guidance an automatic right of appeal existed for refusal of immigration cases. The Home Office’s refusal decision could further be challenged in a Court of Law (Tribunal) and an immigrant could put his/her case forward to an Immigration judge. But not any more! The Government has replaced it with something called an ‘Administrative Review’ – which basically means you have no right of appeal before an independent judge.

attributes.action: Allow Breastfeeding mothers to take children into hospital if admitted
attributes.background: Breastfeeding is often the only source of food a baby will have. Some mothers cannot express and exclusively breastfed babies may not take to a bottle. If a mother who BF had to be admitted to hospital the risk of baby dehydrating is high but also a mothers milk could "dry up" causing distress.
attributes.additional_details: For a mother to be admitted onto a maternity ward with a baby the cut off point is 8 weeks post partum.

attributes.action: Abolish the exemptions that MPs have received from the Investigatory Powers Act.
attributes.background: The Investigatory Powers Act 2016 has just been passed by Parliament. It introduces further surveillance powers for UK spies. Most of the stronger powers require a warrant which can be usually issued by a secretary of state. For MPs, however, the Prime Minister must approve the warrant.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/2016/25/contents/enacted

http://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/gadgets-and-tech/news/investigatory-powers-bill-a7447781.html

attributes.action: Grant 1 year post-study internship stay for international students.
attributes.background: Capacity of international students to develop their countries is limited due to lack of internship opportunities. Increasing post-study stay to 1 year which was reduced from 2 years to 4months in 2012, will benefit developing countries as international graduates can return with better experience.
attributes.additional_details:
International students contribute up to £14.2 billion to UK economy in 2015 (NUS, 2016) with majority coming from resource poor countries (www.hefce.com). 
In the face of ongoing global challenges,  developing future generations of leaders is crucial. 
This can be achieved by allowing international students in UK a stay up to 1 year post-study to seek internship placement and gained practical knowledge. Evidence has shown that on-the-job training provides better learning outcomes (Ellstrom,2014)

attributes.action: Parliamentary enquiry examining fully the DWP and the use of sanctions
attributes.background:
The DWP give cruel, arbitary and ridiculous reasons for stopping benefits. This leads to greater poverty, reliance on food banks, homelessness, hopelessness and suicide. 
A parliamentary enquiry similar to the enquiry held over Sports Direct.
attributes.additional_details:
www.dwpunspun.org.uk
www.rnib.org.uk/dwp-s
60 yr old amputee war veteran had benefits stopped for selling Poppies
Successful job applicants with a starting date in two weeks time, have benefits stopped because they did not continue to search for work in that two week period
A job applicants interview is longer than anticipated  leading to benefit sanctions for one month because they are 9 minutes late for the Job Centre
Benefits have been stopped because no job search took place on Christmas day

attributes.action: Cancel defence cuts to the Royal Marines
attributes.background: Since 1775 the Royal Marines have been the Major Spearhead for the British Army, and have had vital roles since, including both World Wars, Kosovo, The Falklands, NI, Iraq and Afghanistan, and have played a majorly important role ever since. And the U.K has to stop over-cutting them for foreign aid.
attributes.additional_details: Because the cost of the new carriers currently in production and plans toward new equipment, our Defence Secretary Michael Fallon has wanted to cut the 3 front line roles of 3 main Royal Marine Detachments, that's Mad knowing that we have the Fifth biggest defence budget in the world! And it's gotten so bad that he actually ADMITTED that the future of the Marines is "uncertain" meaning that the Marines itself might not exist! And with Gibraltar at stake we need our Finest ready for the Invaders.

attributes.action: Ensure the Pfizer and Flynn Pharma CMA fines are used solely to improve NHS care
attributes.background: Pharmaceutical companies Pfizer and Flynn Pharma have been fined a total of £89.4m by the Competition and Marketing Authority for exploiting a monopoly position over the marketing of the epilepsy drug Epanutin. Their actions have cost the NHS an estimated £44m per year for the last 4 years.
attributes.additional_details: The cost of this scandal has been entirely born by the NHS, and if all the fines are returned to the NHS it will still fall short of the £176m extra the NHS has had to pay for this vital drug. Patients with epilepsy have been most affected, and so some of the money should be used to employ Epilepsy Nurses to improve epilepsy care. See https://binscombedoctorblog.wordpress.com/2012/10/06/the-marketing-of-epanutin-re-energising-a-product-for-an-underserved-population-or-big-pharma-behaving-badly/

attributes.action: I WANT TO GIVE THE HOUSE OF LORDS THE SUPPORT OF THE PEOPLE TO BLOCK BREXIT.
attributes.background: we all know the truth from the lies now and im asking for 17.5 million people to sign this petition or we will be out of the EU forever and i believe the UK will never be the same if this happens.The deal or no deal sums it all up the goverment will destroy this country if we dont stop them.
attributes.additional_details: NOTHING IS IMPOSSIBLE MAKE HISTORY BY SIGNING THIS PETITION WE MUST STOP TERESA MAY.

attributes.action: Disability Benefits for IBD Crohns/UC Sufferers living with a chronic Illness
attributes.background: Unemployed Crohns & Ulcerative Colitis sufferers who suffer daily and those who end up with major surgery resulting in ileostomy and/or Colostomy don't get any financial help to live with the disease.
attributes.additional_details: All they can do is get a sick note from a GP and send it off to the DWP which results in filling out a medical assessment form. Then they get an appointment to see a Medical Doctor and the final decision is "your fit enough for work".

attributes.action: Investigate covert foreign interference in EU referendum and other UK elections.
attributes.background:
The CIA in the US and the BfV in Germany have both spoken of Russian attempts to manipulate elections. 
It is naive to think that the UK would somehow be exempt from or immune to such assaults. There are rumours that the EU referendum was similarly targeted, and future elections remain vulnerable.
attributes.additional_details:
It is important that the full scale of any manipulation is known, so that trust in democracy in the UK is restored and any necessary precautions can be developed.

It is noteworthy that in the US/German cases, promoting a fear of immigrants has been a major tactic.

German BfV statement: (16 Nov 2016; Reuters) http://reut.rs/2gZS17j

US CIA/FBI statement: (16 Dec 2016; Washington Post) http://wapo.st/2h9yKg0

EU referendum: (14 Dec 2016; The Independent) http://ind.pn/2i2Jeh5

attributes.action: Stop ALL spending by UK Gov on Foreign Aid and divert it to the Care Budget.
attributes.background: We can't afford to look after our own citizens, but still send money overseas, why?  We must no longer neglect our own citizens, who worked hard to build our country and paid into the very same system that now neglects them but sends money to countries that do not need it!
attributes.additional_details: Raising council tax to pay for care, when it will not be enough or guaranteed to actually be spent wisely on care (that's if it gets into the care pot at all!).  We need to focus on those that paid into the system and look at the ways we should be working with everyone in our communities to integrate care and develop more beneficial caring environments for the future benefit of all.

attributes.action: I want to stop housing developers selling new build houses as leaseholds
attributes.background: I want the big house builders to stop selling houses as leaseholds. This is adding costs to home buyers and making their houses difficult to re-sell and expensive to maintain. Unlike Flats there is no Legal need to adopt this practice it is purely driven by greed and is an unregulated activity.
attributes.additional_details: Developers have been selling detached and semi-detached houses as leasehold, with clauses which allow the ground rent to double every 10 years. The freeholds are then sold on to private companies which extract the ground rent, charge high fees if a homeowner wishes to make alterations, and refuse to sell the freehold except for a huge premium. Homebuyers have been left with houses they cannot sell as lenders will no longer offer mortgages against them because of the ground rent clauses.

attributes.action: The right for transgender men to be on a baby's birth certificate as dad!
attributes.background: Transgender men should be allowed on their partner's birth certificate as dad when the baby is through artificial insemination or Natural Insemination we are men too!! We have the right to be dads we are not adopted parents we are bringing up the child from birth!
attributes.additional_details: I have rung the registry office and been told that we 'might' be treated as lesbian couples and will have to adopt the child which in my opinion is wrong in many ways both me and my Fiancee agree on the fact that I should be dad on the birth certificate I have  been passed around to many people and still have not got an answer. I shouldn't have to question how I'm going to go onto the birth certificate I should just be able to go on it as should any other transman in our situation!

attributes.action: The NHS must continue to supply gluten free bread and flour.
attributes.background: Coeliacs should not be penalised financially due to their condition.
attributes.additional_details: The NHS is considering withdrawing prescriptions for essential gluten free staples such as bread and gluten free flour. The average cost of a gluten free loaf of equivalent weight is over three times the cost of an ordinary loaf. Avoiding gluten is essential if you have coeliac disease and not a lifestyle choice

attributes.action: Liz Truss to work a month in a prison of our choice as prison officer in uniform
attributes.background: So she has a real experience and knowledge of what working in a prison is really like, in order for her to make the right changes

attributes.action: Stop new adopted pet owners from euthanizing them without a Rescue's knowledge
attributes.background: A potential adopter made enquiries to adopt Rexie, a golden retriever, from Safe Rescue, a dog rescue charity. After a homecheck, she collected Rexie on Sat, 11.02.17, initially staying in contact with the fosterer to say how well Rexie had settled in. On Monday Rexie was put to sleep for no reason.
attributes.additional_details: Rexie came to the UK after a hellish start in Romania. Although 14 years old, he was in good health. He had a painful limp due to an earlier break in his leg that had gone untreated. On his arrival in the UK, his new foster parent took him to her vet. It was decided to amputate his leg, after several assessments and x-rays, and Rexie came through this operation well. He adapted to his 3 legs and was able to lead a normal, enjoyable life. His new owner had him pts without the Rescue's knowledge.

attributes.action: Request Government to publish expected pros & cons/Business Case for leaving EU
attributes.background: The detailed plan for Brexit and new trade discussions are confidential, so nobody else can reliably forecast the impact Brexit will have over the next 10 years in terms of immigration levels and key economic measures. The Government forecasts should therefore be published as soon as possible.
attributes.additional_details:
It is usually OBR's responsibility to produce these forecasts, but due to lack of disclosure of all relevant information are unable to do so. 
Immigration levels and the economic/statistical information typically provided in the OBR's Economic and Fiscal Outlook reports should be provided.
Should Government feel negotiations will be prejudiced by revealing this information; they should commit to providing it as soon as feasible and certainly 3 weeks before final vote on Brexit terms take place.

attributes.action: President Trump should be invited to address Parliament during visit
attributes.background: President Donald Trump should be welcomed to the UK in his capacity as head of the US Government and honour Her Majesty with a State visit and address the houses of Parliament.
attributes.additional_details: The UK and US enjoy a special relationship like no other two countries. While former president Obama wanted to send us to the back of the queue, President Trump promised to bring us to the front and partner with the UK on trade and security. President Trump showed the UK his respect by inviting PM May as the first foreign leader to visit him. Regardless of the opinion some hold of him, as the President of the US he deserves the respect he showed the UK.

attributes.action: The UK Government should retain our EU Renewable Energy targets as a minimum
attributes.background: There is speculation that the Government will drop EU Renewable Energy Targets if the UK leaves the EU. To address climate change & to ensure energy security we need a growing renewable energy sector for heat, power & transport fuels. The targets need to be retained with  plans to achieve them

attributes.action: Stricter control of internships to stop misuse of free labour by employers.
attributes.background:
As a graduate we are expected to do ATLEAST a years worth of free internships, however a lot of these 'internships' are full time jobs but unpaid.
The current laws are too vague and open to abuse by unscrupulous employers to basically get free labour.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.internaware.org/understand_the_law

attributes.action: Fund Research into Fibromyalgia
attributes.background:
Fibromyalgia, also called fibromyalgia syndrome (FMS), is a long-term condition that causes pain all over the body.
At present there are no known causes or cure. 
Fibromyalgia can be an invisible illness. Please take 30 seconds to sign this petition.

attributes.action: Referendum to accept final Brexit deal and leave EU or reject it and stay in EU.
attributes.background: Many who voted for Brexit did not have a clear idea of what it would mean or did so as a protest vote. This issue is so fundamental to our future that it would be inconceivable and undemocratic not to give everyone a second chance based on all the facts. 16 and 17 year olds should also have a vote.

attributes.action: Make all schools in England call transgender students by their chosen pronouns
attributes.background: In some secondary schools in England it states in their gender policy that all transgender students should be allowed to be referred to by their chosen pronouns and name. However this is unfortunately not the case in all schools across England.
attributes.additional_details: As somebody who is directly affected by this lack of law and know many other young people in similar situations at school, who have all felt just how devaluing it is to have this basic right refused to us. I believe it is essential that all transgender students are safe to feel respected and valued in our secondary schools across England.

attributes.action: To debate the closure of Holyrood and the Scottish Executive.
attributes.background:
The Scottish Government has shown it is incapable of running our country. 
It has refused to accept the result of the 2014 Independence referendum and continually threaten more division with Indyref2.
attributes.additional_details: It is time Holyrood was closed and all powers returned to Westminster and the nation run properly as a United Kingdom.

attributes.action: Please offer Justin Trudeau, the Prime Minister of Canada, a State visit.
attributes.background: Justin Trudeau is the Prime Minister of Canada — he would be very welcome here.

attributes.action: Please help us stop the closure of Newham Acute Day Hospital.
attributes.background: Newham Acute Day Hospital has helped 1000s of people with mental health problems who are in crisis.  The hospital is a vital, life-saving alternative to inpatient admission.  Let's take a stand against NHS cuts at a time when mental health problems are at epidemic levels in the United Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.newhamrecorder.co.uk/news/health/hospital_bosses_to_consult_on_future_of_newham_mental_health_day_hospital_1_4864973

attributes.action: To have Epilepsy Awareness Month in the UK in the month of November
attributes.background: This month (November) it is National Epilepsy Awareness Month in the US.  In the UK we only have 8 days a year for Epilepsy Awareness and this clearly is nowhere near enough. I have decided to support the US in their amazing efforts and help raise awareness and funds during the month of November.
attributes.additional_details: In the UK, 600,000 or one in every 103 people has epilepsy. Every day in the UK, 87 people are diagnosed with epilepsy. Only 52 per cent of people with epilepsy in the UK are seizure-free. It is estimated that 70 per cent could be seizure free with the right treatment.  There are more than half a million people with epilepsy in the UK. Around 600 people die each year due to Sudden unexpected death in epilepsy.

attributes.action: Reduce Business Rates for Independent Shops
attributes.background: Dramatically reduce business rates for independent shops and small businesses

attributes.action: Stop outsourcing our NHS services to outside Companies
attributes.background: I feel it is totally wrong to outsource our NHS services to private Companies, such as Richard Branson's & feel that the government is slowly beginning to privatize our National Health Service. This must not happen!

attributes.action: UK Government to assemble a team of voting Brexiteers to advise terms of exit.
attributes.background: 23rd June16 17.4 million people(52%) of the population voted for our complete & as immediately possible exit of the European Union(BREXIT). There was many reasons for this which affect the general public & not those of position. A team of general Brexiteers should be a part of Brexit decision making

attributes.action: Petition  requesting Government  not  to apologise for the Balfour Declaration
attributes.background: This opposes a current  Petition requesting an apology which has been created. If there is anything to apologise for it is the failure of the UK Government to implement  it in full after 1933.  The other Petition ignores the fact that the Declaration was unanimously adopted by the League of Nations.
attributes.additional_details:
The Treaty of San Remo gave the Declaration the force of International Law.

The Champion of Arab Independence Col TE Lawrence approved of it.

attributes.action: Keep trains running between Watton-at-Stone and Stevenage after 2018.
attributes.background: Hertfordshire County Council calls on the Government to take action to accelerate the infrastructure works at Stevenage station, to enable Govia Thameslink Railway (GTR) to run trains between Watton-at-Stone and Stevenage after 2018.
attributes.additional_details:
GTR has proposed changes to its new timetable, which include a replacement shuttle bus service between Watton-at-Stone and Stevenage from 2018. This has been blamed on delays to the construction of a fifth platform at Stevenage, which has been pushed back by Network Rail into its work programme for 2019-24.

The council calls on the Department for Transport to work with Network Rail to bring forward the implementation of the fifth platform and keep this important rail link in operation.

attributes.action: Referendum before triggering article 50
attributes.background:
We the UK citizens who do not want to leave the EU want our voices heard. A referendum should be called on remaining or leaving the EU before Article 50 is triggered by the Government.
We believe that many people did not know what they were voting for on the 23rd June 2016.

attributes.action: The Government must declare the actual and true cost of Brexit.
attributes.background: The government should publicly publish a clear, factual and verified estimate for the total cost of Brexit from the 23 June 2015 until 31 March 2019 with all the GBP devaluation, legal, on costs, travel etc declared not hidden as there seems to be some misguided illusion as to these true real costs.

attributes.action: Prevent the local authority budget cuts affecting adult and children social care
attributes.background: Central Government are cutting budgets to local governments which then affect the most vulnerable of society; children and vulnerable adults. Providing social care to children and adults is a statutory obligation and therefore the cuts should not affect these services.
attributes.additional_details:
Furthermore, Central Government should provide more funding to local authorities in respect of Deprivation of Liberty Safeguards. There is an increase in responsibility following the decision in Cheshire West, and Birmingham (DOLS and Children). To cut funding from these areas when the need for such services is increasing, alongside statutory responsibilities increasing is totally irrational, unreasonable, unjustified and unfair.

Stop the cuts to social care!

attributes.action: Repeal the 1955 canal closure act.
attributes.background: Repeal the 1955 canal closure act.To prevent losing more of our Industrial Heritage.And stop developers building on disused canals and surrounding heritage.This will also give restoration groups the possibility of restoring derelict Canals.
attributes.additional_details: Without this act being repealed ,we cannot stop any Local authorities or CRT applying for a canal closure and granting planning permission on derelict canals or nearby heritage sites.
